context.custom_context: Cinematic UK hip-hop/soul rap duet with Cockney street grit and London R&B warmth - triumphant, reflective, raw, spiritual

intro: Every man's got a corner… mine just used to talk back.
hook: I don't run no more, I stand tall,
I've been down before, but I want it all.
Every bruise, every fall, made me recall —
verse_1: Yeah… this ain't no rehab rap, this a resurrection,
Shadowboxin' my reflection, tryna pattern direction.
Heart like London concrete, cracked but it holds,
Every setback taught me how to re-write the scrolls.
Used to drown pain in a liquid belief,
But I breathe through storms now, my calm ain't brief.
Didn't pick this war, but I claimed the strain,
Turned withdrawal into wisdom, loss into gain.
Every trigger tried to pull, but I cut that chord,
Let silence answer what I once adored.
Now I walk cleaner, mind leaner, truth keener —
Used to fade to black, now the frame's clearer.
This ain't pride — this is peace reclaimed,
From chaos I carved a life unnamed.
I was my own crowd, my own corner call —
Every round survived reshaped it all.
bridge: The pain that tried to drown you — became your tide,
The fight that tried to end you — kept you alive.
I ain't battlin' demons — I'm raisin' light,
Every scar's a map — how I earned my right.
Hold that line — never fold that mind,
Every loss was just a redesign.
verse_2: Now I talk to temptation like, "Know your lane,"
You fed off fear, now you starve off shame.
Used to chase numb — now I chase breath,
Used to fear quiet — now I call it depth.
If pain's the teacher, then lesson learned,
I passed exams in the fire I burned.
I don't claim clean — I claim clear sight,
I tell the truth — I don't stage the fight.
Twelve rounds deep and my soul intact,
No relapse — just rematch with fact.
Tell Addiction he trained me well —
He built my hell so I could rebel.
Now I face the mirror — scarred but free,
The man I was is still rooting for me.
final_hook: I don't run no more, I stand tall,
I've been down before, but I want it all.
Every bruise, every fall, made me recall —
Rise again, brother… we don't fall — we learn.
outro: The silence after the fight… that's where victory breathes.

hook.delivery: smooth, emotional, melodic - British soul phrasing, close-mic, soft plate reverb

verse_1.delivery: close mic, grounded spoken-rap with Cockney cadence, dry mix, intimate breath detail

delivery.jean: stronger tone, ad-lib: 'Rise again, brother… we don't fall — we learn.'

production_notes.genre: Cinematic UK hip-hop / soul rap / British R&B / conscious rap

instrumentation.guitar: low electric guitar riff repeating A-C-D-F | A-G-F-D
instrumentation.ambience: faint boxing gym ambience, heartbeat thump, boxing bell

arrangement.intro: ambient gym air, foot shuffle, gloves tapping, low bell ring
arrangement.outro: heartbeat thump → air still → final boxing bell fade

mission_alignment.description: Resurrection narrative - from addiction to triumph, from chaos to peace, spiritual victory through discipline and self-reclamation
